body_html:
@woodthom2 Yes, the GPU build command should be
bazel build -c opt --config=win-cuda --cpu=x64_windows_msvc --host_cpu=x64_windows_msvc tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package after correctly running the ./configure script for GPU build, an example for this is here.
body_text:
@woodthom2 Yes, the GPU build command should be
bazel build -c opt --config=win-cuda --cpu=x64_windows_msvc --host_cpu=x64_windows_msvc tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package after correctly running the ./configure script for GPU build, an example for this is here.
body:
@woodthom2 Yes, the GPU build command should be 
`bazel build -c opt --config=win-cuda --cpu=x64_windows_msvc --host_cpu=x64_windows_msvc tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package` after correctly running the `./configure` script for GPU build, an example for this is [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/ci_build/windows/bazel/bazel_test_lib.sh#L172).
